column4: can someone with a lot of patience help me install a program?
the program comes in tar.gz but i dont know how to run it
you need to extract the program from the tar.gz file.  tar -zxf tarname.tar.gz
i already did that. i put it into /usr/local/src
then i tried to run "sudo make install but i dont know how to run the program now"
im not even sure if i actually installed it that way
how can i check if i installed the program correctly?
It's been a while.  I usually apt-get install things.  What is the program?
i got it from that link: http://draves.org/bomb/bomb-1.26.tar.gz
if i navigate into the extracted folder and type "checkinstall" i only get some basic text
is there a file called bomb in the folder?
wohooo i think i got it!!
i got the deb file now and i already installed it!
but what next? how do i execute it?
not sure.  is there a file called bomb in the folder?
yes but when i click on it nothing happens
if i run "sudo bomb" in terminal i get: bomb: error while loading shared libraries: libpng.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
